pullrequest.title: Improvements to gzlog filter and logging performance

content.raw:
So is this the workflow you have in mind?

1. Record a log file with `gazebo -r ...`; it will be compressed and save every time step
2. Run `gzlog echo -z 30 state.log > filteredState.log`, which makes filteredState.log an uncompressed but sparser log file.
3. Play back with `gazebo -p filteredState.log`
content.html:
So is this the workflow you have in mind?

  1. Record a log file with gazebo -r ...; it will be compressed and save every time step
  2. Run gzlog echo -z 30 state.log > filteredState.log, which makes filteredState.log an uncompressed but sparser log file.
  3. Play back with gazebo -p filteredState.log
